data.title: Portland Trail Blazers’ G League team names Jim Moran head coach
data.meta_description: Moran spent five seasons as an assistant coach with the Portland Trail Blazers under Terry Stotts.
data.text:
Former Portland Trail Blazers assistant coach Jim Moran has been hired as the new head coach of the Portland G League team, the franchise announced Thursday.

Moran spent the past two seasons as an assistant coach with the Detroit Pistons after spending six seasons with the the Blazers (2014-2021) under former coach Terry Stotts.

Moran, who played collegiately at William & Mary (1997-2001), spent 10 seasons playing professionally overseas.

He began his coaching career with the Blazers in 2014-15 as an associate video coordinator before becoming a full-time assistant the following season.

Last week, the Blazers’ new G League team, which will play at the University of Portland’s Chiles Center, named Danny Connors general manager and Eugene “Pooh” Jeter assistant general manager.

Also last week, the G League team added 14 players to its roster through the G League expansion draft.
